Package com.lukeleber.scandroid.interpreter

The Scandroid API cannot communicate directly with vehicles, so it becomes necessary to utilize a middle-man component ("Interpreter") that translates the digital output from Scandroid to the analog input required by onboard micro-controllers and vice-versa.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Handler<T>
    The Handler interface provides a means for receiving the result of an asynchronous operation at a later date in time.
    Interpreter
    The ultimate base class for all interpreter implementations.
    Interpreter.ConnectionListener  
    Interpreter.ErrorListener
    An optional function object that can be provided to a Interpreter to provide custom handling for any exceptions arising during the asynchronous execution of the interpreter
    Interpreter.ShutdownListener  
    Option<T>
    A simple wrapper class for an arbitrary type that supports custom serialization.
    ResponseListener<T>
    The ResponseListener interface is responsible for acting as a middle-man between the raw data received from a piece of remote hardware and the rest of the framework, providing all necessary pre-processing, filtering, etc...
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractInterpreter<U>
    A reasonable skeletal implementation of much of the Interpreter interface.
    ConfigurationRequest<T,U>
    A type of Request that is used to configure a piece of remote hardware.
    Request<T>
    A common base class for all requests that may be sent over an interpreter.
    ServiceRequest<T>
    A type of Request that is used to request a piece of information from a remote system.

Package com.lukeleber.scandroid.interpreter Description

The Scandroid API cannot communicate directly with vehicles, so it becomes necessary to utilize a middle-man component ("Interpreter") that translates the digital output from Scandroid to the analog input required by onboard micro-controllers and vice-versa. The Interpreter package provides a means by which to communicate with such a middle-man.

The default Interpreter for the Scandroid application is the (awesome) ELM327 product. The ELM327 communicates via strings such that: 

     (--> indicates a data conversion [IE from a byte array to a string])
     (==> indicates a data movement [IE from a phone to the ELM327 circuit board])

     Request
     Android Device --> String ==> ELM327 --> analog signal ==> vehicle

     Response
     vehicle ==> ELM327 --> String ==> Android Device --> User Defined Data Type
